alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 09 at 5:07PM EDT until June 09 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHATHAM AND JASPER COUNTIES... At 506 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Whitemarsh Island to near I-16/I-95 Interchange, moving southeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 503 PM, Chatham Emergency Management reported trees and powerlines down across parts of the Savannah Metro Area. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: Pooler, Tybee Island, Wilmington Island, Fort Pulaski National Monument, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Hunter Army Airfield, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Savannah International Airport, Montgomery, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Thunderbolt, Vernonburg and Sandfly. This warning includes the following interstates: I-16 between mile markers 158 and 168. I-516 between mile markers 3 and 9. I-95 in Georgia between mile markers 97 and 101. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
